titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Foster Jones Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Richard Foster Jones papers
did.abstract: Collection contains manuscripts dating from his period at Stanford as well as papers from his student days at Cornell (1909-1918) and correspondence written during his service as Dean of Graduate Studies at Washington University (1943-1945). Also included are personal business papers and correspondence from 1945-1965.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Richard Foster Jones Papers (SC0118). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Professor of English at Stanford (1945-1952) and founder of the Stanford Creative Writing Center.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection contains manuscripts dating from his period at Stanford as well as papers from his student days at Cornell (1909-1918) and correspondence written during his service as Dean of Graduate Studies at Washington University (1943-1945). Also included are personal business papers and correspondence from 1945-1965.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Department of English. Faculty.

did.unittitle: Papers
Typescript – "The Rhetoric of Science in England of the Mid-seventeenth Century"
Research notes for "The Rhetoric of Science in England of the Mid-seventeenth Century"
Research notes for "The Rhetoric of Science in England of the Mid-seventeenth Century"
Research notes for "The Rhetoric of Science in England of the Mid-seventeenth Century"; and Early papers written while a student at Columbia
"Poetry" – typed
"Literary Scholarship in an Atomic Age" – typed
"Browning and the Greek Drama" – holograph
"Racine and the English Critics of the Neoclassical Period" – typed
"Bacon and the Idea of Science" – typed
"Swift's Fight Against Pedantry" – typed
"Greek Lyric Poetry in the Elizabethan Lyric" – holograph
"Wordsworth's Characters" – holograph
"Dialogue to Pantomime" and "In Imitation of Dobson" – holographs
"Charlotte Hallaran Jones – a Sketch" by Kate E. White. A biography of Jones' mother, 2 copies
Pamphlet – "By Appointment of His Majesty, Biographer of Samuel Johnson, L.L.D." by James M. Osborn
Research notes for a book on language
Research notes from Robert Ferguson's "The Interest of Reason in Religion, 1675" – holograph and type copies
Research notes – miscellaneous and unsorted, 1963
Bibliography of Jones' published writings, 1919-1947; Correspondence
Incoming correspondence from U. S. Armed Services, 1917-1918
Outgoing correspondence, Aug. 14, 1943 – June 30, 1945, written when Dean of Graduate Studies, Washington University
Correspondence with Kenneth Brown, estate manager, 1948-1961
Miscellaneous academic papers; includes degrees, manuscript, class registration booklets (1909-1918), and newspaper reviews.
Miscellaneous financial papers, includes business and tax receipts, medical expenses, and insurance correspondence, 1945-56
Tax files and other personal business correspondence, Feb. – Oct. 1965
Miscellaneous financial papers, 1948-1961
